name: Khao Soi
details: Khao Soi is a Northern Thai noodle soup made with chicken, curry paste, coconut milk, and egg noodles. It is typically garnished with crispy noodles, pickled mustard greens, and lime wedges.

name: Som Tum Tod
details: Som Tum Tod is a fried version of the popular Thai salad Papaya Salad. It is made with shredded green papaya, carrots, and green beans, coated in a crispy batter and served with a sweet and sour sauce.

name: Gaeng Hang Lay
details: Gaeng Hang Lay is a Burmese-inspired curry dish popular in Northern Thailand. It is made with pork belly, ginger, garlic, and a blend of spices and is typically served with rice or roti.

name: Moo Ping
details: Moo Ping is a popular street food in Thailand made with marinated grilled pork skewers. It is often served with sticky rice and a sweet and spicy dipping sauce.

name: Tom Yum Goong
details: Tom Yum Goong is a spicy and sour soup made with shrimp, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and chili peppers. It is often served with rice and is a popular dish in Thailand and other Southeast Asian countries.

name: Pad See Ew
details: Pad See Ew is a stir-fried noodle dish made with wide rice noodles, soy sauce, egg, and Chinese broccoli. It can be made with various meats or seafood and is a popular street food in Thailand.

name: Kai Med Ma Muang
details: Kai Med Ma Muang is a stir-fried chicken dish made with cashews, onions, and dried chili peppers. It is often served with rice and is a popular dish in both Thailand and China.

name: Gaeng Keow Wan Gai
details: Gaeng Keow Wan Gai, also known as Green Curry Chicken, is a popular Thai dish made with green curry paste, coconut milk, chicken, and vegetables such as eggplant and green beans. It is often served with rice.
